summary: We testified that the Department of Veterans Affairs faced challenges obtaining critical medical supplies for its medical center during its response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Further, an antiquated inventory system made it harder for the VA to track levels of personal protective equipment at its medical centers. In addition, the VA has delayed the rollout of MSPV 2.0—the next iteration of its own medical supply...
title: VA Acquisition Management: COVID-19 Response Strains Supply Chain While Modernization Delays Continue
